quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Lyrics
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, crickets, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Blues legend B. B. King made the Hall of Fame in 1998 for his single The Thrill Is Gone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lucille

questions.question: Name the song by Bob Marley that contains the following lyrics: Good friends we have, oh, good friends weve lost along the way. In this great future, you cant forget your past; so dry your tears.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No Woman, No Cry

questions.question: Name the Dusty Springfield song that contains the lyrics, Being good isnt always easy, no matter how hard i try.

options.text: I Wish Id Never Loved You

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Son of a Preacher Man

questions.question: The song A View to A Kill was a big hit song for this group in 1985.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duran Duran

questions.question: This rock groups self titled IV album contains the song that is the most requested song on FM radio. What group recorded the song that begins with the lyrics “There’s a lady whos sure all that glitters is gold.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Led Zeppelin

questions.question: “Tall and tan and young and lovely
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saxophone

questions.question: This country great advised “Stand by Your Man” because after all hes just a man.” Who sang Give him two arms to cling to and something warm to come to when nights are cold and lonely.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tammy Wynette

questions.question: Jiminy Crickets, you should know this beloved Disney song that won the 1940 Oscar for Best Song! If you travel on the Disney Cruise Line the first seven notes of what song will be used as the ships horn signal?

options.text: You Can Fly, You Can Fly, You Can Fly
When You Wish Upon a Star

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When You Wish Upon a Star

questions.question: This song is on the Grammy Hall of Fame by several different artists including Lena Horne and Ethel Waters. There is “gloom and misery” because “when he went away the blues walked in and met me. Can you name this song first introduced at the Cotton Club in 1933?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stormy Weather

questions.question: What is the title of the popular song by the Eagles that contains the following lyrics: And I was thinking to myself, this could be Heaven or this could be Hell. Then she lit up a candle, and she showed me the way?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hotel California

questions.question: This popular song by James Brown contains the lyrics, When I hold you in my arms, my love cant do me no harm.

options.text: Its a Mans Mans Mans World
Get Up (I Feel Like Being a) Sex Machine

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Got You (I Feel Good)

questions.question: Which song by The Beatles features the lyrics, And when the night is cloudy, there is still a light that shines on me, shine on until tomorrow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Let It Be

questions.question: This song was the first # 1 Billboard hit for the mop-top boys from London. The lyrics arent earth shattering but I think youll understand.” What song was the first of 19 songs to take the # 1 spot for the Beatles?

options.text: I Want to Hold Your Hand

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Want to Hold Your Hand

questions.question: The lines Load up on guns and bring your friends; its fun to lose and to pretend are from this song by Nirvana.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Smells Like Teen Spirit

questions.question: The lyrics Every street you walk on I leave tear stains on the ground; following the girl I didnt even want around is from which song by the The Jackson 5?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Want You Back

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Singer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, jam, drummer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which drummer joined Pearl Jam when Matt Chamberlain left after only a few shows with the band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Abbruzzesse

questions.question: What was the original name of Pearl Jam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mookie Blaylock

questions.question: Which popular Seattle band was formed by two members of Mother Love Bone, after the death of their lead singer Andrew Wood?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pearl Jam

questions.question: This group had a very popular album in the 1990s with Californication.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Hot Chili Peppers

questions.question: While Alice in Chains were on tour promoting the album Dirt, their bassist Mike Starr left and was replaced by Mike Inez. Which was the band in which Inez was playing when he was invited to Alice in Chains?

options.text: He was not in any band at that time
He was playing with Ozzy Osbourne

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was playing with Ozzy Osbourne

questions.question: The song We Didnt Start the Fire was  a HUGE hit song for this singer in the year 1989.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Joel

questions.question: Temple of the Dog is a grunge supergroup, formed after the death of Andrew Wood of Mother Love Bone, by his former roommate. Members of which 2 Seattle groups were in the band?

options.text: Pearl Jam and Alice in Chains

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pearl Jam and Soungarden

questions.question: The video clip of which song from Pearl Jams album Yield was made by the famous comic book artist Todd McFarlane?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Do the Evolution

questions.question: Uncle Albert  Admiral Halsey was a big #1 U.S. hit song for this singer in the 1970s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney

questions.question: What is the name of the song that Jerry Cantrell, guitarist of Alice in Chains, wrote after the death of lead singer of Mother Love Bone, Andrew Wood?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Would?

questions.question: What is the name of the video compilation with Nirvana live acts, released only two weeks after the popular Unplugged in New York?

options.text: From the Muddy Banks of the Wishkah
Silver: The best of the box

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Live! Tonight! Sold out!!

questions.question: Andrew Wood of Mother Love Bone, Kristen Plaff of Hole and Layne Staley of Alice in Chains died because of a drug overdose. Which was the drug used in all of the three cases?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heroin

questions.question: The song Upside Down was a big chart topping hit for this RB diva in 1980.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diana Ross

questions.question: This singer had a big U.S. #1  hit song in 1980 called Woman in  Love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbra Streisand

questions.question: In which documentary movie did Nirvana and Sonic Youth participate in 1992?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1991: The year punk broke

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Pink Floyd
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, pilots, pink. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The 2005 Live 8 concert was the first time that Pink Floyd performed live with Roger Waters since what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1981

questions.question: Which company was hired to design the cover and album jackets for Pink Floyd?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hipgnosis

questions.question: What is the name of the Otis Redding album which contained the song (Sittin On) the Dock of the Bay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dock of the Bay

questions.question: Which member of  the English rock band Pink Floyd released a solo album entitled About Face?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Gilmour

questions.question: On which of the following Tesla albums can you find the song Modern Day Cowboy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Five Man Acoustical Jam

questions.question: David Gilmour released his solo project On an Island in the UK on March 6, 2006. What is the significance of this date?

options.text: There was nothing special about the date.
It was his 12th anniversary with wife Polly Samson.
It was the anniversary of the release of Pink Floyds first album with him as a member.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was his 60th birthday.

questions.question: What was the B-side track on the single release of Pink Floyds Another Brick in the Wall Part II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One of my Turns

questions.question: Which early Pink Floyd song was originally titled Lets Roll Another One?

options.text: Set the Controls for the Heart of the Sun

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Candy and a Currant Bun

questions.question: How many studio albums did Pink Floyd release without Roger Waters as a band member?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: What was the name of the cow pictured on the cover of Pink Floyds 1970 album Atom Heart Mother?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lulubelle III

questions.question: What song are these lyrics from Im tugging at my hair, Im pulling at my clothes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Things Ill Never Say

questions.question: On which Allman Brothers album can you find the song Whippin Post?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Allman Brothers Band

questions.question: What was the first Pink Floyd album, recorded without Syd Barrett, that was actually a movie soundtrack?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Music from the Film More

questions.question: Which of these albums by the Stone Temple Pilots includes the song Plush?

options.text: Tiny Music... Songs from the Vatican Gift Shop

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Core

questions.question: Which was the Pink Floyd album on which keyboard player Richard Wright did not appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Final Cut

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Marvin Gaye and Marvin Gayes
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, singles, kung. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Marvin Gaye had three #1 singles in the USA. Which is the odd one out?

options.text: I Heard It Through the Grapevine

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whats Going On

questions.question: Which of these statements is untrue?

options.text: Marvin Gayes first wife was Anna Gordy, Barry Gordys sister.
Marvin Gayes second wife was about 17 years younger than he was.
Marvin Gayes first wife was Gwen Gordy, Barry Gordys sister.
Marvin Gayes first wife was about 17 years older than he was.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marvin Gayes first wife was Gwen Gordy, Barry Gordys sister.

questions.question: When did Marvin Gaye record the Motown hit Sexual Healing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: never

questions.question: Marvin Gayes first  musical  jobs were singing and playing drums in his fathers church. What denomination was the church?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: House of God

questions.question: Why did Marvin Gaye move to Europe?

options.text: He had tax problems as an indirect result of his divorce.
He wanted to get away from Motown.
He wanted to be alone with Tammi Terrell.
He admired the music sound from Europe in the early 1970s.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He had tax problems as an indirect result of his divorce.

questions.question: Marvin Gaye was the first Motown singer to be given total control over his records.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which was Marvin Gayes first Top 40 hit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hitch Hike

questions.question: This singer had everybody Kung Fu Fighting in the year 1974. This song proved to be his only ever #1 U.S. hit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carl Douglas

questions.question: The song Kyrie was a U.S.  #1 song for this band from Los Angeles, California.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mister Mister

questions.question: How did Marvin Gaye die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: shot by his father

questions.question: Marvin Gaye was born April 2. Which statement concerning his birth is true?

options.text: He was born Marvin Perez Gay, Jr., in Washinton, D.C. in 1939.
He was born Marvin Pierce Gaye, Jr., in Washinton, D.C. in 1939.
He was born Marvin Pentz Gay , Jr., in Washington, D.C. in 1939.
He was born Marvin Pentz Gaye, Jr., in Washington, D.C. in 1939.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was born Marvin Pentz Gay , Jr., in Washington, D.C. in 1939.

questions.question: What was Marvin Gayes first jobs with Motown?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: session drummer for The Miracles

questions.question: Marvin Gaye had hit duets with several famous female singers. Which of these is the odd one out?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dottie West

questions.question: Which of these was Marvin Gayes first Top Ten hit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pride and Joy

questions.question: Who is the man who discovered Marvin Gayes talents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvey Fuqua
